item.title: Why do we pay to park our cars if all the parking spaces/double yellow lines are all used up by gainsborough primary school parents with pick ups and drops off throught the day, 28th January
item.description:
Many parents arrive and park where ever they want. On yellow line. On zig zag lines. Residential bays .coming to pick and drop kids off. They use permit bay to park their car resulting in those who pay for a permit not able to find a space. Unfair
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Berkshire Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain cover been damaged and tilts leaving a gap. Lots of litter in the gap and surrounding area. It is right next door to the BUPA care home and is likely to lead to rats., 28th January
item.description:
I noticed the problem when visiting the Care Home (BUPA, 2-8 Hatherley Rd, Sidcup, DA14 4BG) and alerted the Care Home staff.

item.title: No waiting time plate stolen again, 28th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jubilee Way, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 38, 28th January
item.description:
Pavement is completely uneven and mangled. To the point the gate to my property is blocked by the pavement. The tree is likely the cause of the issues, but the pavement is in dire need of repair. I have myself tripped on the jagged edges multiple times. The edging of the curb also juts out as a result of the tree, which is lovely but the surrounding pavement/curb needs to be addressed. The issue has been in place for many years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Roderick Road, Gospel Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surface Water Flooding, 28th January
item.description:
Surface Water Flooding over Dulwich Wood Park as there are no gullies capture the water flows, During winter months water flows are ongoing from the "triangle" green area. This water flows over footway and then road. This causes long continuous period of surface water over road. This water can freeze over causing dangerous ice on the footway and road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich Wood Avenue, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nasty footway ponding when stepping off buses, 28th January
item.description:
Nasty footway ponding when stepping off buses on Crystal Palace, just where buses stop. Passengers must either jump off the bus to avoid splashing into the footway way, or step down very slowly to avoid splashing. Footway repairs need to stop ponding by bus stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Parade, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
